page.title: 07THE COWICK ORDINANCE
page.content: Cowick, for a brief period became the unofficial seat of Government in 1323. Edward 11 called a meeting of his council at Cowick and hammered out an agreement with his ministers known as the Cowick Ordinance. The purpose of this document was to introduce graeter efficiency into the keeping of the Royal accounts. An indication of the importance of this piece of legislation can be gleaned from the presence of the Archbishop of York, The Bishop of Exeter, The Earls of Kent, Pembroke, Norfolk,Arudal and Surrey. In order to make the Manor House fit for the meeting building operations costing over Â£300 were undertaken.
